column4: Does anyone know of a way to create a symlink which can be opened in both Windows and Ubuntu? ... Whenever I make a Linux symlink, Windows fails to recognize it; and whenever I create a symlink in Windows (using the mklink command) Ubuntu fails to recognize it.
not that I know of, sorry. In windows, Symlinks are small text files with meta information while in linux they are special inodes without file content
Thanks.  If I'm unable to find one which works, I'll try and find a work around
